Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Callum H
Reviews.Content: The experience at this hotel was brilliant. We requested room 309 and the kind friendly helpful staff granted our wish. The room was huge i'd assume one of the biggest in the hotel as ive seen people compalin about size of rooms. View from our room of the Basilica Maria Magliore were amazing with the added bonus of the terrace which was breathtaking at sunset. Breakfast was standard but nice, the location was perfect for most monuments especially the coliseum.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LoveYourLibrary
Reviews.Content: Rome, like London, can be tricky for hotels : Town centre ones are cramped and old, but the modern spacious ones are 20kmoutside the city, this hotel manages to walk the water between these problems : very spacious room ( corner rooms at 301/301, 401/402 probably largest Light buffet breakfast but that's standard in Italy so all fine Nearby a few great Irish/international pubs off all corners of st Maria maggore-- I case you want to find English speakers or watch the rugby I'm sure I've stayed in a dozen Rome hotels and I would definitely recommend this one

Reviews.Title: “The receptionist in the daytimes was awfull....”
Reviews.Author: wade w
Reviews.Content: He was unkind and so on. The nightman was very kind and polite. The hotel is ok, big room and clean, but the breakfast is not for a 4 star hotel, no egg and bacon f.ex. The location is fine, the citybus stops 50 meters from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in a good location without any service”
Reviews.Author: JoakimH
Reviews.Content: Hotel gallia are in a good location of Rome, close to Termini station and Colloseum. The standard of the hotel are just ok, not better. Our room smelled mould and were not in a good condition. Breakfast at the hotel were not good. Worst of all were the service from those working there, no one liked guests. (except the guy from sperlonga) There are definetely better option for better prices, this were also expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location, Clean and Easy for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: spiro_sc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gallia is a great hotel for location and price. Don't expect a lavish room but expect a comfortable stay for a few nights (i recommend 3 nights maximum in Rome to see everything) Room was clean upon arrival and also cleaned every day to an acceptable standard. Front desk staff were pretty laid back and didn't pay too much attention to you, but remember you are in Italy after all :-) Breakfast was mixed review between the Mrs and myself. First all, if you go during summer then you will experience breakfast on the rooftop of the hotel which is amazing. The food served is very basic. 2 cereals (some type of corn flake and some muesli) there are no eggs or bacon (I am sure if there was that they wouldn't be that great anyway) but there were the usual croissants, fruits, yogurts ect... Overall not bad, but you will most likely need to snack during the day. Check out was easy, just give back the key and your gone. If you are intending to utilize the train service then this hotel is great because Rome Termini is only a short walk up the road. We did it with 2 large suitcases with ease. Overall an easy stay in the heart of Rome which didn't cost the world and you can get around on foot very easily. Thank you Gallia for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: thinkgroup
Reviews.Content: Firstly the good news. The Hotel is very well placed. minutes from some beautiful sites, minutes to the hop on hop off bus (20 euro for 24 hours) and 5 minutes walk to the train station. Also the evening staff were very helpful and gave us lots of recommendations and organised transfers for us (the day staff were not as helpful). They organised airport to hotel transfer for 55 euro and to the Cruise Port for 120 Euro and Cruise Port to Airport for 110 Euro. The also recommended a number of local restaurants. We enjoyed the pavement restaurant to the right of the hotel (when facing) it was open until 2am, had a very broad menu and the staff were great. There are dozens of restaurants within walking distance but be aware it is expensive to eat out in Rome (but then it is in most City centres). If your on a budget there are a couple of take away pizza shops in the same road and a store which is open to 11 where you can buy drinks and icecream. The hotel has free wifi which was great. Now unfortunately to the downside. We stayed 3 days and it was very hot. We complained daily that the aircon did not work - to be fair they provided us with 2 fans almost immediately but the room was quite unbearable outside of the fan draft. We had a strange room for 3 with an annex round the corner for my sons bed. He had a window - our room was windowless so with no aircon you can imagine. We did consider leaving our bedroom door open as the outside corridor was lovely and cool and managed to fight the urge. The fridge was also broken in our room and we had been hoping to keep cokes and water we had bought for ourselves cold which did not happen. Window in the bathroom offered two options closed or fully wide open - which I do not recommend as there are at least 20 windows which looked into the bathroom. TV was old fashioned and had 9 channels with just the one in English which was CNN and that channel only worked for one day. The shower was broken and we often had to leave it running for ages to get hot water - luckily it was so hot in the room we did not mind the cool water. Many of the tiles in the bathroom were hanging off as was much of the wallpaper in the bedroom - really the room we were in was in desparate need of an overhaul. Breakfast is served on the top floor which has beautiful views all over Rome. There are 12 tables so if you have a lay in there is a bit of a scrum for somewhere to sit, also the buffet kept running out but the one waiter who worked up there did he best and was running around to please everyone. Unfortunately, there were dozens of wasps up there and many people jumping up and running round to get away from them. To be fair there has been an outbreak of wasps everywhere this year. The area is open all day if you want somewhere to sit in the sun but there are no drinks up there so take your own up. There is a room safe and lots of wardrobe space but the room was covered in dust - on the lights, bedframe, tables. This was room 101.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mihaela p
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel after having a bad experience with another hotel in Rome, so we were very pessimistic, but this hotel was really great! The location is fantastic, next to a famous church, Santa Maria Maggiore, the rooms are cosy and clean, the breakfast is served on the terrace, so , while eating you can enjoy as well the amazing view ( the st pietro cathedral is visible) . In one word, it is a hotel decorated and maintained with care and love, the personnel is very friendly and helpful, especially Pietro at the reception, he gave us a lot of tips about fantastic restaurants in Rome, and thanks to him we have now unforgettable memories from Rome. Internet connection was fast and free, parking is in the neighborhood and costs 25 euro/day. So, I would recommend this hotel from the bottom of my heart, it really deserves the four stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Hotel Gallia”
Reviews.Author: Jamihal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gallia in July 2011 and have no complaints about this wonderful hotel! This was our first time in Europe and we had heard the hotel rooms are very small, however we found our room at Hotel Gallia to be large with a large private bathroom. Breakfast was great - served on the rooftop terrace which was beautiful! The air conditioning was cold and worked great (unlike previous reviewers who reported the air conditioning did not work that well). The location is perfect - we walked to all of the major attractions (Colloseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc). The staff was also very friendly and helpful regarding tours, etc. A restaurant tip - eat at "La Carbanara" - turn left out of the hotel and walk down a few streets and it's right there - make a reservation! Best restaurant we ate at! All around, a great trip in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible to say the least! Do not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: ASeyed
Reviews.Content: Booked because of the location, to start of with woke up in the morning to have a shower no hot water. The shower head also just slides down, complained and was told leave it running till it heats up, so following morning let it run and still cold. Second day got back from tour, went back to our room to lie down, a cleaner or handyman or something basically opens the door and storms in, without knocking. My wife went down to complain and was told the cleaner must have thought you were on tour, and keep your key in the lock when you come back, what the hell? Also why was the cleaner in our room, when the room had already been cleaned? the queen bed is 2 single beds joined together, should be 1 star hotel. Never again! Also wifi signal is hopeless!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RXJimbo
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Rome for her 30th birthday. Found the Gallia through a travel agent and it was pretty cheap for the location and time of year. The room was very large with a rustic feel to it. It was clean and tidy, maybe a little dated for some peaoples tastes but we enjoyed our stay. The location is fantastic and we were able to walk to most of the attractions with relative ease. Just a helpful note, there is a fantastic restaurant about 100 yds from the entrance. Turn left out of the main door and its a small fronted building with a pianist in the window. You may not notice it during the day as it has metal shutters over the windows....but ayt night, this is probably the finest place i've eaten (for my budget) in Rome. We had the girlfriends 30th birthday night in there and they gave us two bottles of wine (one was just Prosecco) and a traditional 7 course meal!!! - followed by a full 12X12" Tiramisu. The meal was about £115 for the two of us but for the quantity and quality I think that is pretty good! All in all this is a good standard hotel that is perfectly located and clean. A good nights sleep in an enveloping bed follwed by a hot shower and some sticky sweet cakes for breakfast....just what i needed!!!! The roof has a fantastic view and has potted citrus and olive trees and is very well maintained. Great view over Rome! Thanks Gallia, will be using you again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowShadow
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about this hotel as other reviewers have said, although we got a taxi back from the Vatican in the afternoon and it was 23 euros, not 10 as another reviewer said. The hotel is jaded and our room (305) was disappointing. It was quite dark, only having one window, and noisy. It was not cleaned properly as we discovered a hat and a tablet under the chair which were there all week. We were only given plastic cups in our room, not glasses and these were not replaced all week. The breakfast was served in a windowless room with no atmosphere. I believe it is served on the roof terrace in high season which must be lovely. There are lots of lovely restaurants in the area for dinner at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room, great view”
Reviews.Author: JamesBanner
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Gallia as me and my girlfriend went away to visit Rome for 4 days before Christmas. Upon arrival we left our luggage in reception (as check in is 1pm, I've noticed some people seem annoyed when told they can't check in, but that's when it is and it says when you book). I also didn't think anything of them taking our passports when we first arrived, as they gave them back when we came back downstairs. We went for a look around the immediate area before check in, and the main central travel hub for Rome (Termini Station) is 5 mins walk away from the hotel (you could see it from our room). Here you can catch any number of buses, trains, the tram or metro to anywhere in Rome. Also underneath the hotel a few doors down is a supermarket/bar which sells pastries/drinks etc. but are quite expensive. If you're looking for cheap bottled water try one of the shops on the way to Termini which sells bottles for 50 cents. The room was very large (room 308), and had one double bed (Note to other reviews, according to my research on-line it is normal in Italy for a double bed frame to have two single mattresses pushed together rather than one large mattress). Also present was a free electronic locking safe, sofa, TV, wardrobe (see picture) and huge bathroom. The room seemed very traditional and of Italian décor, and wasn't in disrepair like I have read in other reviews. We had 3 large windows, 2 of which overlooked the beautiful Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore across the street (see picture). We did notice a slight sewage smell upon entering the room each time, but this became unnoticeable after 1 minute in the room and is seriously not a reason to not book a room at this hotel. I have noticed other reviews of 308 are good too, this is possibly because in high season the hotel can charge around 400 Euros a night for this room (as it says on a piece of information in the room itself). Needless to say I got the room last minute for 225 Euros for 3 nights and we were overall impressed. The only negative feature of the hotel we found is we found it quite hard to sleep some nights, however this was not due to noise outside despite the hotel being on a busy-ish road (the windows are pretty soundproof), I think it was just because the bed was not what we were used to. Also, the front desk staff whilst being very friendly were not as helpful as we have found with recommendations as staff are in other countries such as Spain. For example, he did give us some recommendations but they weren't personal, rather they were from business cards that restaurants had left in the hotel. Having said that, it's probably more likely due to how the Italians came across generally to me than the level of their professionalism at this hotel; I'm sure that we British seem moody and unhelpful to tourists! Worth mentioning as a good point too is the breakfast (7-10am), which was included in the price of our booking. Choice includes everything in a traditional Italian breakfast amongst other things, coffee and tea (which are brought fresh to you by a waitress when you enter the room), meat, cheese, bread, sweet croissants, yoghurt, cereal, fruit, cake. We forgot to look at the roof terrace as the weather was mainly cold during our stay but can imagine eating breakfast on the roof with the great view would be amazing. As I already mentioned, the location is great. Termini, whilst not being the most attractive area is a major transport link to the rest of the city. If you travel past the station (as we did when we went to Formula 1 pizza), expect graffiti on every single wall and on most vans and cars. However, don't let this put you off, as you will probably not need to go any further North East than the station itself when visiting Rome, we just happened to go that way on our first night for pizza. Also, this is probably the only area we saw during our stay that was like this, and we covered almost the entire city. Overall we were very impressed with this hotel and it's price. The view is beautiful (make sure to visit inside the Basilica) and if you want to be at a good starting position for visiting the sights of Rome then near Termini is the place to be. Something else worth mentioning is the star rating system in Italy/Rome. It is not the same as elsewhere around the world, hotels are star rated according to what/how many facilities they provide, so 4 star Hotel Gallia is not the same as 4 star Hilton or something like that! If anyone has any questions as regards to travelling around Rome, where are must see places, or anything else please email me or message me :)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: cindyellen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is dirty, wallpaper coming off walls. Beds, sheets towels the same quality as a youth hostel. Front desk not helpful. TV did not work and they did not care. Smoking hotel and every room stinks. Dirty bags, plates etc in reception area. Chairs tables etc at front desk old and dirty.Rugs are stained. Leg of the desk fell off in middle of night. Terrible by any standards.. Breakfast is fine and location is good but lots of other hotels to choose from. This should be a 2 star not a 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel near the crosslines of metro - train”
Reviews.Author: EriAntwerp
Reviews.Content: good location ( on foot ) near the Main trainstation and the metro lines, room on 4th floor ( streetside ) but a good sleep, bathroom - shower can use an upgrade, but works well, breakfast buffet ( with also fruit ) is nice on the roof terrace reception desk is helping out with a good advise

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms for Italy!”
Reviews.Author: SoxFans07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our visit to Rome and found the hotel to be quite good. There were 4 adults and a child in our group, in 2 rooms. Both rooms were very good size, especially compared to some of the others we had stayed at in Italy. The location was very central we could easily walk to the Colusseum and the main attractions, with the exception of the vatican..but this was only @ 10 euro cab ride. The breakfast was OK and service was good..only regret is that it was not on the roof top every day, only 1 of the 3 days we stayed..as the view from there was absolutely beautiful! As others had mentioned the front desk not extremely helpful, with the exception of the night manager, who went out of his way to find information regarding the train schedules for us, including printing us the timetables and a map. Overall, very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bhusawal
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Hotel itself quite good. Met all expectations. Front desk staff appears little aloof and cool to customers. Appeared to us that they would give information or recommendation only if asked and that too very to the point. Hotel is on a busy street hence noisy. Overall recommended

Reviews.Title: “If location is matter for you- you found it here!”
Reviews.Author: ukitraveler
Reviews.Content: It is not something modern, but you will find a relaxing room that you need after exploring Rome. Most of staff is friendly and helpfull. 3-minute walk to Termini, very close to Collesium and Paladine Hill.Location is +++. Room is comfortable, calming, clean. No noise from outside(may be we have been so tired, that haven't heard it!). Breakfast can fit different diets. Lady serving at the breakfast room is a pleasure - she is next to your table as soon as you only think about having cup of coffe.

Reviews.Title: “great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: andowi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gallia is near the Santa Maria Maggiore, and our room had a great view on this Basilica, conseqently the room was very noisy as it was in front of the hotel on the corner, you had to keep the windows closed.The bed's were quite hard to sleep on. Staff was friendly but also reserved.The room was average clean, but was't cleaned during the days we stayed there. Everyday clean towels. Breakfast buffet was great, lots of choise, bread, croissants, cold meat, cheese, fresh fruit, etc. The room was old and little worn, but we were there only tot sleep, therefore good enough to stay for our trip in lovely Rome. Close to Termini, metro and bus.

Reviews.Title: “I threw a coin in the fountain to return to Rome, and when I do I will stay at the same hotel - the Gallia”
Reviews.Author: barbara_stewart2
Reviews.Content: Sometimes we stay at a hotel and I say afterwards - if I return to this area I will stay at the same hotel. This is what I said about the Gallia, and I can't wait to return. Hope the three coins in the fountain works! We stayed for three days in May 2008. It was within walking distance of the main station and right next door to the Santa Maria church which is one of the loveliest churches I have ever been into. Yes, the hotel is old - but then Rome is old. I liked the old atmosphere and the quaint rooms, unusual shapes, a triangular bathroom, roomy, with bath as well as shower. I liked the bedroom, very comfortable, with a well stocked bar and drinks on the house. It was all clean and we slept well. Yes, the noise of Rome is outside - but then we were not staying on an isolated island! We had not chosen a peaceful holiday. I liked the passionate roar of the traffic and the music of church bells but more than anything, I loved...adored...the roof garden. After exploring the sights, it was lovely to return to the Gallia late afternoon. My husband always had a nap on the comfortable bed, but I took a glass of wine and my book up to the roof garden and could have stayed there forever! I hardly read actually, I just wanted to take in the spectacle of Rome around me. I could look over on to other roof gardens, the glistening white church next door, and across the rooftops of Rome, towards the Vatican. In the summer, breakfast is served on the roof. What a place to have breakfast! The other thing I appreciated was that all the main sights, apart from the Vatican, are a short walk away from the hotel. Ten minutes takes you to the Coliseum, another five minutes and you are walking along Via del Corso,a most beautiful street, another ten mins (if you don't stop to shop) and you can be at the Spanish Steps. In a side street near there is my favourite cafe, the Cafe Grecco, one of the first cafes in Rome, visited by many famous people and now serves delicious food in an old fashioned, beautifully decorated atmosphere. Mext to the Spanish steps is the Shelley Memorial House, open to visitors. Another ten minutes and you can be at the Trevi fountain. Walk to the end of the Via del Corso and you come to the Plaza del Popolo, and from there you really must walk up to the Borghese gardens. The Pantheon is another must; wonderful inside. One of my favourite piazzas is the Navona, not far from the Pantheon; I like eating here. But we found a gem....in the same street as the Gallia hotel, just a few doors down, we happened to go into a restaurant because I liked the fact that there was someone playing a piano! What we found, in this small back street restaurant, away from the touristy places, was a family run restaurant, where a lot of locals eat, with home made food and a lovely atmosphere. I would go back to the same restaurant again. Unfortunately, I can't remember the name of it but it is close to the hotel on the same side of the street. So all of this is close to the Hotel Gallia, apart from the Vatican, across the river. We made the mistakke of going by taxi, booking it from the hotel. Cost £50. Another time it will be bus! And there is a long wait to get into the Vatican, about two hours at least. Although I believe I read somemwhere that you can book in advance and go straight in. The wait was well worth it. This hotel is away from the main touristy area yet close to the sights; it is a delightful place to stay. I wouldn't call it luxurious, but had character, cleanliness and comfort. I'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lennart123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for anyone who loves the smell of sewage in all of the room all day and night long, and in additin to this loves that tha staff is lying to you. I had to move to another hotel. I would not even recommend my worst enamy to stay in this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING - DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: SallyB42
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this Hotel on Friday afternoon at 2.00pm for a weekend stay to find that this hotel had booked our room out to someone else! They tried to offer us a single room with a double bed in it but it was so small you couldn't even swing a cat in it! We then got a taxi to another hotel (Hotel Torino) who, after seeing a further two other rooms, did finally upgrade us to a suite. Hotel Torino were very friendly and the hotel was, although a bit tired, clean and comfortable. We phoned the manager who was very rude and basically told us to either accept it or find another hotel ourselves before he hung up on us. Very unprofessional and when you are only in the country for a couple of days you do not want to spend it looking out for another hotel after you have already spent several hours on the internet researching locations of lots of hotels and looking at pictures before you make a decision. I would warn anyone who likes the idea of this hotel to seriously think again because you could find yourself like us having booked it well over a month before our visit being told that there is no room, even though we had a reservation code. DO NOT TRUST THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location, air conditioner quite uneffective”
Reviews.Author: alexbottoni
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel online on the basis of its good location (very near to Termini metro/train/bus terminal) and of the available reviews. The hotel is quite old but still confortable. The first day we asked to change our room because of a noisy a/c and we were immediately satisfied. Double rooms are quite large and confortable and the bathrooms are new and confortable as well. The entire hotel is very clean and quiet. We just have to complain about the air conditioner that was quite uneffective. The staff was very, very friendly, even if you have to speak some italian to be able to appreciate his friendliness... Santa Maria Maggiore is a very good starting point to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: LeedsMarty
Reviews.Content: My partner and i had a superb stay at the gallia,the room was very good ,the garden terrace is excellent,the mini bar had the cheapest beer and wine in rome which was consumed on the terrace,breakfast on the terrace was nice,the hotel is in a great location five minutes walk from termini and opposite the superb basilica of st maria maggiore,would definiteley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, In a great location.”
Reviews.Author: lolly8t8
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay in the Gallia Hotel and I dont have a bad word to say about it. I found the staff to be helpful and very friendly, the location is perfect within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Coliseum.And if you dont fancy the walk Termini station is five minutes away from where you can take the metro. The room had all the facilities you could ask for from a city hotel. Good bathroom with shower and comfortable double beds, t.v, armchair,fridge. Room was slightly small but so are many hotel rooms that are loacted in major cities. Considering there was so much to see and do in Rome you only need the room to sleep. Breakfast was good at the hotel with lots of choice. There was a small bar but I cant really comment on that because didnt use the bar on our stay. I really dont understand how many comments are made about the staff they were always helpful and friendly. I believe if you are friendly people will be friendly back. Im really pleased with every aspect of the hotel which made for an amazing break in Rome. If you do require more information on directions to sights/places to eat and drink etc then please do not hesitate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Gallia 2 star at best”
Reviews.Author: alexander27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Four days this July. Front desk very very unhelpfull, never experienced anything like it. a/c not working first two days, room safe not working, requested they change did so after 2 days, new one had no battery, asked but nothing done, they suggested 'we have a drawer in reception' sure... no toilet paper in room!! until requested! wallpaper in room torn, light shades burnt. plus points breakfast ok, bed comfortable and clean. ok location. no chance four star, two star absolute max. City Great, some great food especially Osteria St. Ana on Via Della Penna, ask for mimo, and his recomedations!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: IHS81
Reviews.Content: Before I went to Rome on a family holiday, I had looked on this site and was slightly apprehensive. It turns out that I had absolutely no need to be! The hotel was fantastic - the staff were very friendly and helpful at all times of day and night, the rooms were very large with plenty of space and nice bathrooms and breakfast was always fresh with lots to choose from. It was warm in the hotel, but you could open the window whilst you were out and that cooled it down, but it was a blessing when it is freezing cold outside to go back to somewhere warm and cosy. In regards to those who mentioned the noise, you can't really expect anything else when you have chosen to stay in a Central Rome hotel, but if you did as much walking as we did, you will be asleep before you notice it (which we didn't with the windows shut!) Great location, Sante Maria is fabulous and only a short walk to the Colloseum, Trevi and St Peter's only cost 10 Euros in a Taxi! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back there”
Reviews.Author: Caesar07
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 nights. The first room that we had booked, a family room, was baking hot and the aircon was exactly that, a con, totally ineffective. Sleeping was difficult enough but to wake at 3.00am with the bed crawling with bugs was totally unacceptable. The night porter managed to find us 2 alternative rooms and we had to drag the children out of bed and move with no help from staff. We expressed our displeasure the next morning and if I could have found an alternative hotel I would have done. We stayed one more night and certainly didn't expect to have to pay for the first room (210 by the way) but we were told that a discount of €25 would be all that was offered, on a room rate of €225 per night. Other than having a stand-up row with somebody in reception and the hotel debiting my card anyway we left as quickly as possible. Needless to say we won't be going back anytime soon. OR recommending that anybody else should stay there, remember room 210!

Reviews.Title: “A Curates Egg”
Reviews.Author: exeman
Reviews.Content: Good Points:- Room was huge - far bigger than we expected for the money. Room was clean, water was hot etc. Breakfast was fine as were the waiting staff. Nice to be near Santa Maria Maggiore and several bus stops. Some good nearby restaurants Bad Points:- Front of house staff very unfriendly. Just tried to look cool in their shades. Not really in walking distance of anywhere at least not in the heat of the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: scrumpyjack64
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say, I won a Trip to Rome and this was booked by the Event Mangers, I was promised a luxuary night in Rome at a 5 star hotel. When we arrived it looks good from the outside, However looks are very diciving we were booked for a Twin room but given a double so I asked them to split the beds and was told they would try but could take a few hours? I have taken photos as they bathroom door could shut properly as the door frame was comming away from the wall, The bedside lamps were falling apart and all the electrical wires were on display, so didn't use them, which ment the room was very dark all through out the day, Holes in the walls and the paper peeling off, the shower and toilets were well just wrong, I have stayed in a cheeper Travel Inn and got more for my money , Good thing is location but thats it the city is full of graphiti and frankly would good back if i was paid. There is NO WAY this is a 5 Star it should be a 2 star if that. Breakfast don't touch it and the mini bar only soft drinks the bar in the evening shuts at 10.00pm.WILL NEVER GO BACK WHAT A LET DOWN

Reviews.Title: “I'd definately go back”
Reviews.Author: Yomster
Reviews.Content: The Gallia Hotel is in a superb location - 5 mins walk from the termini station (although I didn't realise when I arrived and got screwed by a taxi man - so be warned) 5-10 mins from pretty much everywhere else - Collosseum, Trevi Fountain etc. Hotel was very clean and very quiet. I never saw any other guests except for in the breakfast room in the morning. Room was of a standard decent size with a cheap enough mini bar. Plenty of information about local tours and sights were available at reception too.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, but don't expect the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: jennifer410
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to stay at one of the other Leonardi properties-Hotel Viminale- but due to a flood in our room, we were booked here, Viminale paid for and calleda a cab--and we couldn't have been happier! We stayed athe Gaillia for five days. The location is great for exploring. The room was large enough for two-nice big marble bathroom. It was clean and all the amenities were readily restocked. There was a small minibar, and the hotel didn't mind if you used the fridge to store your own wine, fruit, chees, etc.. Handy as there is a supermarket around the corner. I have read a few of the other reviews--we found the staff to be extremely accomodating. They even helped with our Italian, and train timetables. We left Rome for Capri, and the hotel stored our luggage for us for 4 days then had it transferred back to the Hotel Viminale for us easily-it was waiting in our room upon our return. Breakfast is no better, no worse than any continential I've had in Italy, Britiain, France or elsewhere. It is a charming-slightly quirky hotel. We would definitely stay there again! It seems that people too often expect exactly what they have at home in other places--travel is an adventure, and while maybe not 4 star if you're expecting posh--we found nothing, nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Taksidiotis
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday after a week in Rome in the Gallia Hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent. You are within walking distance to everything, taxi drivers know it (rather they know St. Maria Maggiore) and there are bus and metro stations very near. The rooms vary between tiny and ok. The baths are newly done and clean. The towels had some gray stains-probably from being tied up or left outside? but they were nice and big though. The maid and the girls serving breakfast were very nice. Breakfast: was quite limited and quite bad (only one kind of bread, one of cheese, cold hard eggs, one salt shaker (!), bruised or old fruits. The last three days of our stay brekie was served on the roof. First day was sunny and nice, second was raining, third was awfully cold and windy – but if you wanted breakfast you had to defy the elements !!! no alternatives. Reception: As I said above the second breakfast-on-the-roof day was rainy. However no one from the reception bothered to a) come up and check or sent someone to check and b) help the poor hapless serving girl with the umbrellas. Thankfully the guests helped and managed after many tries and lots of dust to open them. And this kind of behaviour was what the reception guys or the “principi” as we called them offered all the time: Arrogance. With the exception of one small young night guy – he was quite friendly. Television: had a few local channels, not very good reception and it was about 3 inches big. No room Service, only one bar where you could have a drink. That is if one of the principe would bother to get the key or serve you. Newspapers: all in Italian No maps or info available except from the advertisements. All in all this is definitely not a four star. We can discuss if it is 3 or 2.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Dungiven
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed as a 4* but I would put it at 3*. Hotel was clean but no bath. Also there was no hospitality tray which one would expect in a 4* establishment. I always enjoy a cuppa especially after travelling and getting settled in to the room instead of having to rush out to a cafe to have a cup of tea or coffee. Also there were no information brochures or maps on Rome which I found not very helpful as we had to go and find an information centre to plot our itinery. I found that the hotel reception staff were not that friendly and could not help us with basic inquiries. The cold buffet was fine but can get boring after 4 days. It did not have satellite TV so we had no news from the UK as I always like to relax for an hour before going out for dinner in the evening and listen to an English speaking channel. The one main advantage that the hotel had was that it was situated in a very central position, only minutes away from Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Aggressively Rude, Rooms Tiny”
Reviews.Author: audrocks
Reviews.Content: Visited the property 12/27/05 - 01/01/06 due to descriptions of central location and combination with air/lodging package. On the positive side the property is, as advertised, a few blocks from the major Rome train station and St. Maria Maggiore (which is stunning and second only to St. Peters in my opinion). Unfortunately this area between the station is a little rough and we were uniformly advised to avoid it after dark by everyone asked. It is a small property (30+ rooms) and most quite small. I saw a room map and every room is a different shape to fit to shape of the building. If you do decide to stay at this property I would only consider a room with two beds. In one double room I was able to lay cross-ways on the bed and touch both walls at the same time. The furnishings are as advertised. The worst aspect of this property is undoubtedly the front desk staff. Both the day and night shift were the most rude I have ever encountered in any hotel. In a large city (New York, Paris, Johannesburg, etc), you can unfortunately expect a certain amount of casual indifference but the staff at the Gallia has created a new low in passive-aggressive customer service. Within the span of 48 hours they 1) hung up on me when calling from my cell phone seeking walking directions from the train station during a hail storm, 2) replied “I don’t know” to every single inquiry about nearby restaurants and attractions (for example, my wife asked which days Maria Maggiore had services and the staff member replied he had no idea – he didn’t go to church there – we should walk over and find out ourselves), 3) hung up TWICE on an America Express agent trying to reach me about lost luggage and then told me they hadn’t called until I later pressed him with EMAIL’ed evidence, and, 4) were locked out of the lobby when returning late one evening because the night shift clerk was lying on the lobby sofa watching television (and he was angry at us for disturbing him). Before you consider staying at this hotel I would call and make a simple, reasonable inquiry for tourist information and make your decision based on the respone.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel located on a busy street. Windows are 90% sound proof but you can still hear the traffic. Location is excellent, rooms are clean. Some have huge twin beds and are spacious while others are small with small twin beds (room 308 for example). Great differences between rooms. We stayed at room 309 which was great and spacious. One more tip - Book directly with the hotel - any hotel in Italy. Skip the agents and the web. call them directly and ask for a price. I called several hotels and some gave me a quote 30-40 euros less (per night!!) than the offers on the web and the travel agents

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel from another which was a bit of a worry at first but when we got there we were pleasantly surprised as it was well above average for a central hotel in Rome. The staff who spoke good English (better than our Italian for sure) were helpful and polite. Breakfast was typicaly continental but nevertheless there was plenty of it. Our room, a twin at the front of the hotel was very quiet, reasonably decorated with a huge bathroom. We missed having a shower rather than hand held attachment from the bath but after a days exploring on foot, the bath was actually very welcome. I can't comment on the TV, we were in Rome so we didn't bother to turn it on, but the room was clean and functional, and more than adequate given the time we spent in it. In summary if you like big spacious modern hotels don't choose Gallia. If you like reasonably priced, functional clean and practical, you would be hard pushed to better this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Stay, Good Location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gallia in July 2004, on our stop in Rome during our honeymoon. The very best thing we liked about the hotel was that it was in a very good location, accessible to almost everything in Rome - *IF* you like to walk. We walked everywhere, although the major exception was to the Vatican where we took a taxi to get there (we were late for a tour) and the subway back. We walked to Termini (main train station) all the time, including when we left Rome for Florence. Directly across the Santa Maria di Maggiore church and plaza (a must see!). The room was not very big, but then again we only slept there. No adequate space for our luggae, so we had to leave it all over the floor, making it even more difficult to get around. The bed was two twins pushed together, so we had that seam down the middle. The bathroom stall was VERY small and uncomfortable, but overall it was very clean. The airconditioning did not work well at all (at least on our room). Breakfast is no big deal (we only went the first day), but the view from the roof where it is served is great! I would describe the staff as indifferent, although they were fairly helpful in getting taxis, directions, etc. when prodded. Many restaurants and cafes in the neighborhood, although at night it does seem to be an area where younger kids hang out. Not too noisy though, slept very well at night and felt safe walking around. My overall description of the hotel would be decent to OK, with nothing really negative to tell. I would not necessarily choose this hotel again if we returned to Rome, but I wouldnt rule it out either. It is difficult to describe a so-so experience that had no really bad qualities. Definitely not a four star hotel, more like a solid three star with good rates (online reservations with orbitz).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gallia Hotel twice during a recent trip to Italy. It is very well situated within reasonable walking distance of historic Rome's major attractions. It is also directly across from the Santa Maria Maggiore, which is one of Rome's lesser known but truly awe-inspiring churches. The hotel also rests on the site of the birthplace and workshop of Gianlorenzo Bernini, whose sculptures are not only world famous but also define Renaissance Rome. Bernini is also buried in a non-descript tomb within the Santa Maria Maggiore. While the room I had was both comfortable and spacious, there are a few cautionary notes. First, service at the front desk ranges from quite good to indifferent, depending who is on duty. Second, the hotel is located in one of Rome's traditionally more down-at-the-heels neighbourhoods (Esquilino) and overlooks a piazza where a fair number of indigents appear to gather nightly. While I never felt at risk, some might have a different reaction. A breakfast buffet is served on the rooftop terrace of the hotel, and is a wonderful way to start the day. The hotel is also located directly above a very convenient cafe where drinks and snacks can be purchased and taken up to one's room or consumed at one of the sidewalk tables.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Gallia for 5 nights in July, its very close to termini, which is convienent. The bedroom I had was on the corner of the building, quite small & in need of some repairs. The room was also very dark and the air conditioning didn't seem too powerful. The shower door was broken & the shower itself is very small. Very noisy at night if you're at the front of the building. I found reception staff to be very unfriendly, however breakfast waitresses were nice & the breakfast was fine. The location is great and the hotel is just about a 3 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good!”
Reviews.Author: Teddy_888
Reviews.Content: Being honest, I chose this hotel due to the reviews on this site and others. I expected a decent hotel for a 4 star hotel but I was greatly disappointed. The hotel is a typical 3 star hotel and does not match to the asian 5 star hotels I have been to. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from the termini hotel and can even be longer if you get lost. The entrance of the hotel is decent and the staff are really short of english. The room is spacious and the bathroom is big. But..... the shower is small. You can just about fit into it. The other side of the bathroom has unplugged shower pipes. My wife managed to hurt herself due to this. There is two type of toilets in the bathroom. The television is a 14 inch television and don't expect to have any english channels. The channels in english are not clear and not receivable. The wall paper is nasty and has just been put up to cover the bad plastering work at the back of it. You can still see the nail etc coming through it. Now for the worse thing.... we did not sleep for the two days in the hotel. Not because we partied all night but because it was very noisey. You can here the noise from the constant moped / motorbikes going up and down the road. Worse still is that you can here people walking and shutting their doors as well as showering in the next door. I really suggest you look hard for a hotel. This hotel is by the cavour metro station and is convenient to get to the coliseum and roman forum. This was the only benefit I got from this hotel. As for changing the room, I got a very rude reply of 'NO'. I am still wondering is it because of the lack of english or just the complete rudeness of the people in question. As for the holiday, rome was ok. The vatican city is a must see incl sistine chapel. Expect queues.... also see the coliseum etc. Trastevere (part of the town) is a dump. Don't forget to see the fountain de trevi. Just to warn you that you will see graffiti throughout the whole city. This really disappointed me as this is the capital of italy and should not be represented this way.

Reviews.Title: “"Good location, Good value for the money"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 3 nights (March 2 thru 5 2005) at the Gallia hotel on our trip to Italy. We were very pleased with our stay. We booked online through Expedia and had no problems with our reservation. We found the hotel to be clean and with nice decor. The room was large and the bathroom as well. Even when compared with most American hotel rooms. The Shower pressure was amazing lots of hot water which I might add felt great after a long day of walking. The Location of the hotel is good. The church of Maria Maggiore is literally a two minute walk and can even be seen from rooms on the front side of the hotel. None of the other attractions are super close but, most are within equal walking distance from the hotel. St peters being the only one you might consider catching a ride too it is easily an hour walk. Everything else is within 15 to 30 to minutes. The staff was overall friendly, helpful and spoke English. Good Coffee! at breakfast. Down the street from the hotel is a great little internet Cafe. Super cheap high speed internet access, very friendly staff coffee and pastries were good too. If you take a left out of the hotel and walk about 5 minutes they usually have a yellow sign out side its on the left. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome. It offers affordable prices with solid accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel IF...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...you bear in mind that a Roman four star rating is roughly equivalent to a Central European three star rating. The Gallia is located opposite Santa Maria Maggiore and is a leisurely ten minute walk from Termini Station (this may save you taxi expenses if you arrive in Rome by train and do not carry too much luggage). Rooms are relatively small but comfortable, and all are air-conditioned. Our bathroom was a bit grimy but acceptable. During the summer months, breakfast is served outside on the roof-deck, which gives guests the chance of enjoying the spectacular Roman skyline. Decent coffee is served. Staff members speak English and are very friendly and helpful. Do not ask them for restaurant recommendations, though. We did so twice and drew blanks both times. If you do not mind short walks (10 to 20 mins.) you will find that the Gallia is conveniently located near many tourist attractions and shopping facilities (Trevi Fountain, Via Nazionale).

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, a safe bet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in Feb 2004, and found it to be a decent, if unremarkable hotel. They say it's four stars, but it is more like three. Our double room was fine, but the bathroom was a bit cracked and mouldy in places - no decent satellite channels on tv, no tea/coffee-making facilities. They say it is sound-proofed but we got quite a bit of traffic noise. On the upside, it's handy for the terminus station, the breakfast was fairly good, although the bar wasn't open when we stayed there. They were happy for us to leave our bags for the whole of our checkout day and there was a taxi rank very nearby. If you want a safe bet for an ok hotel, this is it, but nothing more!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DMK100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located with a view of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. We had a twin room, which was small but nicely decorated, to the front of the hotel with one of the hotel's few small balconies. It had a great view of the Basilica. The room however had a a number of flaws such as torn bed covers (poor for a 4 star) &no plug in the sink. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was good in a buffet style. The hotel is only a short walk (10 mins) from Termini Station which is the main station in the city (you can get a train direct from Da Vinci Airport to Termini).
